subject: Re: [junit] appendMoney method in the examples
msgSnippet: ... If it made the tests passed, then I guess it s what was needed. That s the nice thing about tests: if they pass, then the code is probably correct. ... --
messageBody:
squashphile wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
> I'm new to JUnit and was reading the Test Infected article. I came
> across the MoneyBag class containing the appendMoney method. When it
> says an internal helper method, I assume it is upto the programmer to
> implement it? I wrote something like this:
>
> void appendMoney(Money m){
> fMonies.add(m);
> }
>
> Is this what it was supposed to be?

If it made the tests passed, then I guess it's what was needed. That's
the nice thing about tests: if they pass, then the code is probably
correct.
>
> thanks,
> Ashu
>
>
>
>
>
